intro: Pediomelum digitatum var. parvifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pediomelum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
